Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
door-to-door \door-to-door\ adj. 1. direct without intermediate changes of vehicle; -- of e.g. journeys or deliveries; as, the limousine offers direct door-to-door service. [WordNet 1.5]
2. omitting no one; from the door of one house to that of the next; as, a door-to-door solicitation, canvass, or campaign.
Syn: house-to-house. [WordNet 1.5]

door-to-door adj 1: of e.g. journeys or deliveries; "the limousine offers door-to-door service" 2: omitting no one; from the door of one house to that of the next; "a door-to-door campaign"; "house-to-house coverage" [syn: {house-to-house}]
